entries.content: Objections are not rejections; they are requests for more information.
entries.notes: Encourages viewing objections as opportunities to provide value rather than as barriers.

entries.content: Use questions to control the conversation direction when handling objections.
entries.notes: Questions shift the dynamic and keep the prospect engaged.

entries.content: When told 'I think I'll hang up,' respond with 'Well, you got to go first' to re-engage.
entries.notes: Leverages the prospect's rebellious nature to keep the conversation going.

entries.content: Stay emotionally detached from the outcome to maintain professionalism.
entries.notes: Prevents personal feelings from affecting performance during objections.

entries.content: Frame objections as a natural part of the conversation, not as a stop signal.

focus_area: Objection Mindset: Objections = info requests, not rejections
